lists-iteration_key2: In a class, the teacher marks attendance by calling out the names one by one, from a list of students. This process is called `iteration`.
lists-iteration_key3: `ITERATE` is a very important word, which you should bring in your vocabulary.
lists-iteration_key4: Repeat the same action with each element means `iterate over the list`. There could be many examples of `Iteration` like:-
lists-iteration_key6: one by one to all your friends
lists-iteration_key8: 2.To iterate over the names of students list
lists-iteration_key9: See their report cards one by one
lists-iteration_key10: calculate their marks one by one
lists-iteration_key12: 3.Now iterate over the names of your friend's list
lists-iteration_key13: Giving tea one by one to your friends
lists-iteration_key14: Out of them, the friend sitting nearest to you
lists-iteration_key15: you give them biscuits together with tea.
lists-iteration_key16:
The work that we do repeatedly is called `iteration`. Using `loops`, we have learned how to do `iteration`. But, we don't know how to **iterate over a list**. Now we will learn how to run `loop` on any list.
In this example, we will understand that **how to iterate over the list.**

lists-iteration_key25: Here we have to check in the while `loop` that the value of the index should be less than the`list_length`. The `loop` will stop working at the moment when the index value will become equal to the `list_length`.
